Reviews.Content: Reserved a week, left after first night! I checked the reviews before reserving this place, but I did not heed the warnings. I am a bargain hunter and I reserved a week for a business stay. I left as quickly as possible after the first night. I've stayed in hotels in third world east European countries. This place was worse!I got into my first room (you'll notice that multiple room changes are a regular occurance here). The fridge didn't work and I had to repack, go to the front desk, and request a new room. I got into my second room. Here's a quick list of the problems: 1. Carpet was disgusting. I spent a lot of time the first night trying to guess what the huge stains were on the carpet. I wonder if that place was a crime scene at one point?2. This was a non-smoking room, but that didn't deter cigarette burn holes on all the furniture and throughout the room. I couldn't sit on the couch. It was too nasty.3. The rest of the furniture in the room made my college apartment look luxurious. 4. The dishwasher didn't work and there was garbage in it from where other people have tried to use it (obviously maintenence is not a priority for these folks). 5. The room smelled (see other reviews). 6. The iron had black (something?) on it and the iron board had only one leg. I tried to use one of the shoddy chairs to balance it while I ruined a good shirt with the blackening iron. 7. There was no handle on the tub to switch to shower, so I tried to take a bath.8. Hot water lasted about 2 minutes (honestly). My bath was very short. 9. While sitting in one-inch deep tepid water in the tub, I saw black (something) smeared all over the side of the not-so-clean toilet. 10. The heat lamp in the bathroom was a 60-watt regular light bulb.11. But there's always tv, right? WRONG! The cable on both sets was completely jacked and the reception was so fuzzy I couldn't even watch it. 12. It was either 100 degrees or 20 below. 13. The carpet was ripped in several places. Trust me, if you're going to trip and fall on your face, you at least would like to have decent flooring to fall on. 14. The coffee maker didn't have a lid and wouldn't work. That was a blessing since I found the water holder in it to be completely mouldy. 15. They told me this was a full breakfast. I still can't find anything on google about what red-colored jelly substance scrambled eggs can be cooked in. and the winner is......16. When I demanded to check out the next day due to these and other numerous problems, they told me I would have to pay for 2 nights instead of the only one I stayed. What a rip off!Seriously folks.. this place is not just older or run-down. It's a DUMP! And I'm not being a wimp... I'm a cop, and am used to being a bit tough. This fact about me came in handy as I noticed the crack deal in the parking lot as I left.
Reviews.Author: tbgalileo

Reviews.Content: not bad at all! After reading the other reviews, I almost cancelled and am glad I did not. We are running from Hurricane Ike and may be here for several days. Yes the place is old and a little run down but the rooms are enormous, like a one bedroom apartment, with a fully implemented kitchen, two tvs, several tables and a fire place. The place is packed with other evacuees but the staff had plenty of towels and extra sheets for the fold out sofa. AND the staff was very friendly. The TV remotes were not working and we had new ones withing 1/2 hour. For the price and the size of the room we are tickled.
Reviews.Author: Bruz123

Reviews.Content: Worst stay ever Hi,I moved from Atlanta to Dallas for work. Stayed in this hotel for 3 days before renting an apartment. It was my worst stay ever.At first, the receptionist showed me a room which smelled badly. Then another one which is not cleaned. At last I moved into the third room which was somewhat ok (Maybe when compared to the previous rooms I had seen). The bedspread and quilt were torn at many places. The bath pipes doesn't work properly. Water won't come in shower. Shower curtain is too lengthy that you have to stand on it while bathing. The water in the bathtub will take minimum 15 minutes to empty when you try to shower. Let me come to the story outside the room. You could see people standing on the road inside the inn and drinking beer and chatting in the night. You will never know when your car will be stolen. The management doesn't care.They remodelled some old apartment into this suite. You don't see quality people staying here. The room stinks (I really mean it...always some damp smell in the room). The housekeeping don't know english (U could escape if you know spanish). I think many people here stay for monthly basis. You see someone always outside the room chatting, smoking as if you had come to a gang area. Strangers ask for smoke when you are outside the room. I never felt safe here and immediatly vacated after 3 days and moved to a different area.
Reviews.Author: SRSASR

Reviews.Content: Worst place I have ever stayed at in my 40 years of life Please Please avoid this place.The first room we were put in smelt so horrible.I could taste the smell even when I plugged my nose.My husband had a allergic attack and I almost threw up.They moved us to another rm.Smelt stale but not like the first rm.Pull out sofa had no mattress left.All springs.Back door had no deadbolt.My childrens feet had to be washed because they got so black from the floor.The worst we were going to bed a huge cockroach ran across my sons face in the bed.We fled the hotel AT 1:00AM.I have never in all my year's seen such a place.Not even when I have paid much less a night.The girl at the front desk was nice.That is the only good thing I can say about this horrible scary place.Please don't let the pictures on the internet fool you.
Reviews.Author: MKarl

Reviews.Content: Horrible does not begin to describe this 鈥榟otel鈥?! Review for Quality Suites13636 Goldmark Dr. Dallas, TxDo NOT stay here!!!(Sorry in advance that this is so long, but I feel you really must read!)We had reservations to stay at this hotel because I had to go to Dallas for medical test.I did my first round of test and we went to the hotel to check in. My friend went in, checked us in and off we went to our room. We were supposed to have a Smoking King Room with Sleeper sofa.I did not go in the first time, because it is difficult for me to walk. So of course our room was (in building 11) upstairs. We opened the door to our room and there was a massive stench. But we proceeded on to check it out. We found:- There were stains all over the carpet, - Burn marks, - A metal vent covering in the bathroom that was just hanging down loose. That could have seriously hurt someone since the ceiling was slanted and it hung down so low. I鈥檓 short, but it could have hit me in the head.- Some of the lights came on, some did not. - Most of the electrical outlets did not have any covers on them. (We did finally find the source of the stench. There was standing, moldy water in the dishwasher. Along with dirty dishes). - There was not a working lock on the door. Not even a safety lock up top that every hotel on earth has. - No ashtrays in a smoking room. - NO bedding for the foldout sofa.I called the front desk and got a man. I told him some of the issues in the room; he said he would send someone up right away. After waiting for quite some time, with no one showing up鈥?I called back. This time I got a personality impaired young girl. She said 鈥淚鈥檓 talking to a customer, call back鈥? And hung up on me. Well what am I? I called back about 5 minutes later and she said, 鈥淗ow did you get in that room?鈥?I told her we checked in about an hour ago. 鈥淪he said, 鈥淚 don鈥檛 know how you got in that room. If you want to talk to me come down to the desk.鈥?I told her that is why I was calling鈥?it鈥檚 hard for me to walk all over the complex. She said, 鈥淚f you have something to say come down here. I don鈥檛 know why you are in that room!!!鈥? And hung up on me..again!We hobbled down to the front desk. Which was not easy. Explained everything to Miss. Personality. She did try to defend the room. And tell me that it was ok. Which it was NOT. I was not a happy customer at this point. A man showed up behind the counter and told her to cancel someone else鈥檚 reservations and give us that room. I asked if it was smoking. They said yes. And it鈥檚 a King room, correct? Yes, yes it is. It was on the other side of the complex in building 17. I explained to them again how hard it was to walk up and down the stairs. And all over the complex. Their attitude was 鈥榦h well鈥? No help with luggage 鈥?nothing.So we had to walk back to our building, up a flight of stairs, get our luggage, walk back down the stairs, load everything back up in the car, drive to building 17, unload everything again, walk back up another flight of stairs to finally get to the second room.This room looked like someone had kicked the door in at some point. The molding around the door was half way tacked back on. There was a gap in the door, so you could see in the room from the hallway.Being gluttons for punishment 鈥?we proceeded on to the room. This room was much smaller. It did have a sofa 鈥?that was broken! The cushions would not even fit on it anymore. And it had that鈥? 鈥楧irty upholstery feel to it. - This carpet was worse than the first room. Didn鈥檛 know that could be possible. But it was.- There was NO kitchen. After assuring us there would be. - The refrigerator was broken. (Which was all we had. No microwave鈥othing else)- Same deal with the electrical outlets. Most did not have a cover on them. - There was a huge gap in the floor going out to the balcony. If you had a Chihuahua it could have gone through this gap under the door without a problem.- The nails were all coming up on the balcony. Neither of us tempted fate to step out onto it. I鈥檓 quite certain it would not have held us up!- There was again, NO lock on the balcony door. None.- There was NOT a king bed. Not even a queen. It was a full size bed 鈥?with one tiny little pillow. Like a throw pillow. Maybe one foot by one foot. With NO pillow case. - And the air-conditioning was broken.- NO bible in either room. Not a big deal to some, but we found it odd.So, I again called the front desk. I got Mrs. Personality again who told us to come to the front desk. I told her that was not happening鈥?and the problems with the room.I was told that we could not get another pillow because each room has a pillow and that is all that they have. Pretty much deal with it. No pillow case. No extra pillow. That is just how the room is. Come to the front desk and they would see what else they had.We really didn鈥檛 need to talk about it anymore. I was beyond irritate at this point. I told her never mind. We would look for another hotel. And do NOT charge us for this room. This was ridiculous. The manager was there and told her to tell me that he would give me $5 (Five dollars) off of the room if we would stay! Haha. I would not have stayed at that point if he had paid for the room! They assured us that we would not be charged.It was nasty, filthy, serious personality issues with the 鈥榮taff鈥?and basically NOT a safe place to stay. So called hot tub packed with leaves and debris. Pool was.. not something I felt safe in testing without a medic close at hand. I have been all over the world. I have stayed in some pretty odd places in third-world countries 鈥?they were by far much better than this place! Even in Belize (before it became a big tourist attraction) had some pretty strange places to stay. But they were clean. And they were at least friendly. This place needs to be shut down. We did go on to find a really nice room for only $10 more at Best Western Suites 鈥?Addison. Which I don鈥檛 care how much more it was. It was worth every penny!They had a wonderful happy hour. Wonderful. Very nice staff, everything was just amazing. They made you feel like you were staying in a 4-star hotel. I would highly recommend it!!After getting back home, we found out that they did charge our credit card for the room. But would release the funds. Which will take several weeks. I called the 800 number for the chain and complained. I was told that they could not refund the money, nor pay for us having to move, no compensation at all because each hotel was individually owned. So it was up to that owner to decide what to do. Want to guess what this owner has done? ** there was a sign by the pool that said 鈥淧lease shower before entering鈥?br/>I have never seen that before. You know it had to be a problem at some point for them to put this huge sign up!
Reviews.Author: jodimm

Reviews.Content: Rude people and no longer owned by Best Western Now Luxery Suites, owned by foriengers that are rude and refuse to give rates over the phone, will tell you when you get there. Why? If you look like you have alot of money are they going to charge more. Plus, not only was I hung up on, the manager also told me to go to [--]. I could only imagine the service. I tried to make a reservation over the phone, when phone was answered as Luxury Suites, I asked if this was Best Western. First hangup. Call back - Why did you hang up me was told because you did not say anything., they must have phone problems, when I asked about rates I got the we do not give out rates over the phone, they change every minute (rip off warning). When I commented that I did not want to make a reservation without knowing rates, they hung up on me again. 3rd call back, same woman answers, I ask to speak to the manager, she says she is the manager and told me to go to [--].No way in [--] would I give these people my credit card info. No telling what they would charge. Very rude foriegners. Maybe they run their businesses like that in their country, but here in the states - No Way, find a better place to stay.
Reviews.Author: DedeeTexas

Reviews.Content: don't stay here unless you're a glutton for punishment Place is a mess, inside and out; extensive remodeling going on, but no effort to clean up debris. Don't think they own a vacuum cleaner; A/C non-existant (99 degrees when we stayed). Hot tub and pool are full of dirt and debris; posted pic's are from bygone days when the place was actually kept up....not the case now. Gave away our suite the first nite before our arrival, so they put us in two seperate rooms, one of which had no A/C and the other never got down bbelow 85. Was given a refund the next morning and transferred to the only working suite. Upon checkout- was charged for two nights in the suite, and they refused to honor the first nights refund even though I had the refund receipt to prove it, but offered a $10 discount for the discomfort.......said they were loosing too much money already.......NO WONDER. Complained to Best Western Corporate, said they would make them refund the overcharge and send a rep to investigate the place. There are many better places to stay for the same price, with no hassles or discomfort.
Reviews.Author: aboyd

Reviews.Content: To Be Avoided at all Costs This property is a disaster zone! Avoid this at all costs. I made a reservation via the Best Western[--] website for this property. I arrived at midnight after a six hour drive to have some rude Indian woman tell me that they didn't have my reservation or a room and then proceeded to interogate me about how and where I made the reservation! I explained I made it on the hotel website. She said that the Best Western website does not 'communicate' with their hotel property. It gets worse. She said that they had no rooms. Then, she tells me that she will check one room to see if it is clean. She starts to walk me into the dingy, dark courtyard area. I turned around and walked away. The property was absolutely scary at night to say the least. There was no lights and it looked like an abandoned property. I cannot believe that Best Western would allow this property to continue as a franchisee. It is beyond belief. I called Best Western customer service to report the problem. I could tell my call was routed overeseas. They could care less.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Best Western Dallas Telecom Area Suites I stayed at the Best Western at 13636 Goldmark Drive Dallas, TX from April 4 to April 12th. To say this is a three star suite hotel would be stretching the truth to almost breaking. The three star rating was from the web site I booked my stay. When I checked in on April 4th the person behind the desk did not go over any of the amnities they had or where anything was except how to get to my room. The suites are older converted apartments or condos. They are very roomy and have a lot of closet space also the bathroom has a lot of cabinet space. These are pretty much the only positive things about the suites themselves. The room at first glance did look clean but when you looked a little bit harder you could see old spider webs and new ones. Also the bed spead on the bed had blood stains. The kitchen did have a microwave like was listed but it was from the ealier 80's and I was afraid to use it since it was almost as old as me. The hi speed access is WiFI so if you do not have wireless access on your computer you can use the dial up access available. The pool that was mentioned was not ready for use and it seemed like it may not be ready for quite awhile. Also their was a fountain on the site and it was in the same awful shape as the pool. The over all look of the grounds was also in bad shape. When I found the washer and dryer that the guest could used I found that they had been vandilised and had not been replaced but they had tried to repair instead.The reason why I did not give this suite hotel a two instead of a one is because the cleaning staff did change the sheets every day which is something I want.
Reviews.Author: rainbowfrog

Reviews.Content: Absolutely Horrible I thought this would be a nice place for my family to stay at for a week, I was wrong. First of all, the management and staff were rude and made us feel like we were not very welcome. We arrived at our room, which was not cleaned. The entry door was broken so that it could be pushed open even when locked. The sofas and carpet were stained, our microwave in the kitchen didn't work or even open. The door into the bedroom had a crusty yellow substance all over it and some of the panels were broken. The bathroom was disgusting. The toilet was not cleaned, there was make-up from a previous guest all over the counter and hair dryer. Our shower didn't work and the shower curtain also had drips of some substance all over it. We had the manager come look at the room, and we asked if we could switch to a different room. She was not cooperative at all, she blamed us for the filthy room, saying that we messed it up (even though we had only been there for 10 minutes), she also accused us of stealing the 2nd television which was not supplied in the first place. The manager was very very rude and verbally abusive to us. We decided to move to a different hotel. We took pictures of the room and its condition and reported the manager to the Better Business Bureau. I would definetly suggest NOT staying at this property.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Lots of Space A pleasant stay--room was very large and had a unique floorplan. Looks a little aged, but was clean and quiet. The Air conditioner was not efficient, but luckily, it was a very cool week in Dallas, so we did not suffer a bit.The area around the hotel seems to be mainly Spanish-Speaking. However, I did not feel unsafe in the hotel or its grounds.If you need a large room and a reasonable rate for business travel, and don't mind an older property, this may be the place for you.
Reviews.Author: kcbknupp

Reviews.Content: Loved the rooms! My family and I stayed here over the weekend for my daughter's cheer competition! It was my husband, myself, and 4 children. No one complained the whole time and they all loved the room. I liked the fact we could all stay in one affordable room! Normally we have to get 2 rooms. The staff was very friendly and made me feel at home here. The rooms were roomy like an apartment and the kids loved the upstairs and fireplace! The dishwasher did not work but then who wants to do housework when away from home? The sofa bed was a little lumpy and not as comfortable but the kids were able to sleep on it. The grounds were very nice and got some great pictures of the girls in their cheerleader uniforms around the pool etc. We had no problems finding it and will definitelty stay here in the future!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: A Rundown mess Was out here last weekend to catch a baseball game with parents and nephews. Place was not easy to find....may have been more to do with massive construction on 635 and US 75 though.Place is run down and worn down. Curtains, carpets and bedspreads were worn. Beds were reasonably comfortable. Toilets ran and made slight noise, that was annoying sometimes when air conditioning was running. Door jam to main door was partially broken. Room was mostly clean, though I did spot some stray hairs in the carpet, and a used condom wrapper in one of the bedrooms - thankfully the nephews didn't see it.The condo-ish style of the room was interesting to say the least and was diferent then what I normally stay at. Appliances were older but functional. 3 TVS were decent and new,limited choices of channels though.Breakfast was disappointing and was skippable. Hot-tub near pool was not working. Staff was friendly, but I had some language difficulties with some of the staff. Felt unease, as far as my safety was concerned - nothing specific, just had a bad feeling with the rundown facilities and the neighborhood. Unless they renovate, I wouldn't recommend the place. And even then, I wouldn't likely stay there.
Reviews.Author: BCC1972

Reviews.Content: Bad Management I have stayed at this location before and it was old but clean and safe. This last visit I felt that it was not as clean, did not feel as safe, and it was more run down than before, ie. missing tile off the wall in the bathroom, water stains on the ceiling, non working fridg, closed pool, etc.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Lots of room Enjoyed our week stay at this motel. It's more like a one-bedroom apartment than a motel suite. Full size kitchen appliances (older, but working fine). Large living/dining area and a nice-sized bedroom. Felt like a small, quiet community, with pretty landscaping between the buildings. Good breakfast buffet. A great deal for the money!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
